entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin XT Fork
entry.summary: In a series of emails on the bitcoin-dev mailing list, members discussed a recent post by someone claiming to be Satoshi Nakamoto regarding the need for a better incentive for users to run nodes. While some members questioned whether the message was authentic or not, others focused on the content and its relevance to the Bitcoin community. Oliver Egginger noted that despite doubts over the message's authenticity, it contained useful information which he had learned from. Hector Chu asked whether the incentive was for full nodes or miners, to which another member replied that there was already plenty of incentive to run a node, but mining could be done without running one. The idea of making P2Pool the only pool allowed on the network was suggested, although there were concerns about scalability. Oliver Egginger later commented that the focus should be on the content of the message rather than on its authorship, since the headers checked out and the mail server used was not an open relay. He also noted that the message contained a request to eschew arguments from authority and to focus instead on the merits of ideas. In conclusion, members agreed that regardless of its authenticity, the message raised important issues that deserved attention and discussion within the Bitcoin community.
